definition: to set each other off nicely
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)
old variant of 映[ying4]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
interesting/to interest

sentences.english: You bet it is, but the contrast between the beautiful photography and dog poop is remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 不过美景和狗屎相映成趣倒是让人过目不忘。

sentences.english: We can see ancient and modern buildings next to each other in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我们能在北京看到古代和现代建筑相映成趣。

sentences.english: The polished surface twinned his face and chest in reverse.
sentences.chinese: 光亮的表面与他黝黑的脸庞和胸膛相映成趣。

sentences.english: Stream of life always gain by contrast and pebbles.
sentences.chinese: 小溪的生命总是和鹅卵石相映成趣。

sentences.english: With window outside moving scenery union, as soon as in moves calmly one, pours also forms a nice contrast.
sentences.chinese: 与窗外动人景色结合，在一动一静中，倒也相映成趣。

sentences.english: You can see the rhapis gracilis in the fish pond and the water lily next to each other.
sentences.chinese: 观赏鱼池里棕竹摇曳生姿，与水面上的荷花相映成趣。

sentences.english: Rock rocks area around the water, mountains and rivers Xiangyingchengqu.
sentences.chinese: 水岩景区怪石遍布，山水相映成趣。

definition: to reflect/to shine
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
to set off by contrast/antithesis/analogy parallelism (linguistics)
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
trees/greenery
to have quite a lasting charm
strewn at random/disorderly/untidy/irregular/uneven
to blend into one another/to blend together well
hidden from view/alternately hidden and visible/setting off each other
(of scenery) stunning/spectacular/picturesque
uneven and jumbled (idiom); irregular and disorderly/in a tangled mess
verdant
greenish-blue/emerald green
to reflect (producing an inverted image)
